sample_texts.welcome: Welcome to TTSFM! This is a free text-to-speech service that converts your text into high-quality audio using advanced AI technology.
sample_texts.story: Once upon a time, in a digital world far away, there lived a small Python package that could transform any text into beautiful speech. This package was called TTSFM, and it brought joy to developers everywhere.
sample_texts.technical: TTSFM is a Python client for text-to-speech APIs that provides both synchronous and asynchronous interfaces. It supports multiple voices and audio formats, making it perfect for various applications.
sample_texts.multilingual: TTSFM supports multiple languages and voices, allowing you to create diverse audio content for global audiences. The service is completely free and requires no API keys.
sample_texts.long: This is a longer text sample designed to test the auto-combine feature of TTSFM. When text exceeds the maximum length limit, TTSFM automatically splits it into smaller chunks, generates audio for each chunk, and then seamlessly combines them into a single audio file. This process is completely transparent to the user and ensures that you can convert text of any length without worrying about technical limitations. The resulting audio maintains consistent quality and natural flow throughout the entire content.

docs.title: API Documentation
docs.subtitle: Complete reference for the TTSFM Text-to-Speech API. Free, simple, and powerful.
docs.overview_desc: The TTSFM API provides a modern, OpenAI-compatible interface for text-to-speech generation. It supports multiple voices, audio formats, and includes advanced features like text length validation and intelligent auto-combine functionality.
docs.feature_voices: 11 different voice options - Choose from alloy, echo, nova, and more
docs.feature_formats: Multiple audio formats - MP3, WAV, OPUS, AAC, FLAC, PCM support
docs.feature_openai: OpenAI compatibility - Drop-in replacement for OpenAI's TTS API
docs.feature_auto_combine: Auto-combine feature - Automatically handles long text (>4096 chars) by splitting and combining audio
docs.feature_validation: Text length validation - Smart validation with configurable limits
docs.feature_monitoring: Real-time monitoring - Status endpoints and health checks
docs.new_version_desc: Docker images now bind to 0.0.0.0 automatically, fixing localhost-only launches and 502 errors. Docs were refreshed with Host override guidance for locked-down deployments.
docs.authentication_desc: Currently, the API supports optional API key authentication. If configured, include your API key in the request headers.
docs.text_validation_desc: TTSFM includes built-in text length validation to ensure compatibility with TTS models. The default maximum length is 4096 characters, but this can be customized.
docs.text_validation_warning: Text exceeding the maximum length will be rejected unless validation is disabled or the text is split into chunks.
docs.preserve_words_option: Avoid splitting words when chunking (default: true)
docs.get_formats_desc: Get list of supported audio formats.
docs.validate_text_desc: Validate text length and get splitting suggestions.
docs.response_audio: Returns audio file with appropriate Content-Type header.
docs.response_combined_audio: Returns a single audio file containing all chunks combined seamlessly.
docs.long_text_desc: The TTSFM Python package includes built-in long text splitting functionality for developers who need fine-grained control:
docs.manual_splitting: Manual Splitting: Full control over text chunking for advanced use cases
docs.word_preservation: Word Preservation: Maintains word boundaries for natural speech
docs.separate_files: Separate Files: Each chunk saved as individual audio file
docs.cli_support: CLI Support: Use `--split-long-text` flag for command-line usage
docs.auto_combine_note: For web users, the auto-combine feature in `/v1/audio/speech` is recommended as it automatically handles long text and returns a single seamless audio file.
docs.combined_audio_desc: Generate a single combined audio file from long text. Automatically splits text into chunks, generates speech for each chunk, and combines them into one seamless audio file.
docs.chunks_combined_header: Number of chunks that were combined
docs.audio_size_header: Final audio file size in bytes
docs.openai_compatible_desc: Enhanced OpenAI-compatible endpoint with auto-combine feature. Automatically handles long text by splitting and combining audio chunks when needed.
docs.auto_combine_param: Automatically split long text and combine audio chunks into a single file
docs.auto_combine_false: Return error if text exceeds max_length (standard OpenAI behavior)
docs.max_length_chunk_param: Maximum characters per chunk when splitting
docs.chunks_combined_response: Number of audio chunks combined (1 for short text)
docs.original_text_response: Original text length (for long text processing)
docs.audio_combination_desc: Uses advanced audio processing (PyDub) when available, with intelligent fallbacks for different environments. Supports all audio formats.
docs.use_case_articles: Long Articles: Convert blog posts or articles to single audio files
docs.use_case_audiobooks: Audiobooks: Generate chapters as single audio files
docs.use_case_podcasts: Podcasts: Create podcast episodes from scripts
docs.use_case_education: Educational Content: Convert learning materials to audio
